summary: The text recounts the punishment of the Jewish people following their rejection of prophets and the execution of just people, including Jesus, from Abel to the apostles. This divine retribution is enacted through the Roman commanders Vespasian and his son Titus, who destroy Jerusalem and Judaea. Miraculous signs, including a star resembling a sword, and other supernatural occurrences precede the destruction. The Roman siege and devastation coincide with a large gathering of Jews in Jerusalem for Passover, reminiscent of the time of Jesus's crucifixion.
